results.adx_keywords: Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Firearms;Children and Childhood;Mabry, Reggie (d 2022);Ayala, Marie (1994- );Orlando (Fla)
results.title: Mother Charged With Manslaughter After 2-Year-Old Fatally Shoots Father
results.abstract: It is unclear how the boy managed to get the Glock 19, but his mother acknowledged that “any child in the room could have figured out how to get the gun out of the bag,” the authorities said.

media.caption: A Glock 19, the same model gun used in an accidental shooting by a 2-year-old, on display at the National Rifle Association’s annual meeting.
media.copyright: Patrick T. Fallon/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: Company Reports;Shopping and Retail;Consumer Behavior;Standard & Poor's 500-Stock Index;Target Corporation;Walmart Stores Inc
results.byline: By Melina Delkic and Jason Karaian
results.title: Target will take a profit hit to clear out inventory that shoppers don’t want.
results.abstract: The move shows how inflation and changing consumer behavior are souring the business outlook for many retailers.

media.caption: “Trends have changed rapidly since the beginning of the year,” Target said in a news release.
media.copyright: Cornell Watson for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Gun Control;Firearms;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Second Amendment (US Constitution);Politics and Government;Crime and Criminals;Supreme Court (US);New York State;New York City
results.title: New York Officials Fear Supreme Court Ruling Will Mean More Gun Crime
results.abstract: The Supreme Court is expected to rule on — and possibly overturn — a century-old law that allows local officials great discretion over who can carry a handgun.

media.caption: The New York Police Department has recovered more than 3,000 guns this year.
media.copyright: Dakota Santiago for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Colon and Colorectal Cancer;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Clinical Trials;Research;Immunotherapy;Dostarlimab (Drug);American Society of Clinical Oncology;New England Journal of Medicine;GlaxoSmithKline PLC
results.title: A Cancer Trial’s Unexpected Result: Remission in Every Patient
results.abstract: The study was small, and experts say it needs to be replicated. But for 18 people with rectal cancer, the outcome led to “happy tears.”

media.caption: Sascha Roth, the first patient in the trial, unexpectedly learned she had rectal cancer in 2019. Her gastroenterologist, she recalled, told her during a sigmoidoscopy, “Oh no. I was notexpecting this!”
media.copyright: Shuran Huang for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: your-feed-science;Monkeypox;Masks;Smallpox;Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
results.title: Monkeypox Can Be Airborne, Too
results.abstract: An abrupt change in C.D.C. guidance underscores a little-known phenomenon: On occasion, monkeypox can be transmitted through aerosols, similar to the coronavirus.
org_facet: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

media.caption: Scientists say that the monkeypox virus can be airborne, although that route of transmission is only a small contributor to its overall spread.
media.copyright: Erika P. Rodriguez for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Suits and Litigation (Civil);Massage;Football;Spas;Women and Girls;Buzbee, Tony G;Hardin, Rusty;Watson, Deshaun (1995- );Cleveland Browns;Houston Texans;National Football League
results.title: How the Texans and a Spa Enabled Deshaun Watson’s Troubling Behavior
results.abstract: Watson met at least 66 women for massages over a 17-month period, far more than previously known. He had help from the Houston Texans, including nondisclosure agreements, in making appointments.

results.adx_keywords: Amusement and Theme Parks;Weddings and Engagements;Disneyland Paris;Walt Disney Company
results.title: Disney Apologizes After Employee Thwarts Marriage Proposal
results.abstract: A man had been planning for months to pop the question at Disneyland Paris, but the employee instead snatched the ring and ushered the couple off a stage.

media.caption: The main public entrance to Disneyland Paris.
media.copyright: Alex Cretey-Systermans for The New York Times

results.title: There’s a Reason Kim Jong-un Wants Us to Know About North Korea’s Covid Outbreak
results.abstract: Mr. Kim may be ready to re-engage with the world.

media.caption: Kim Jong-un appeared in a face mask on television for the first time on May 12 to announce a nationwide Covid lockdown.

results.adx_keywords: Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);United States International Relations;Putin, Vladimir V;European Union;North Atlantic Treaty Organization;Ukraine;Russia
results.title: The Ukraine War Still Holds Surprises. The Biggest May Be for Putin.
results.abstract: Russia’s president probably feels that he’s calling all the shots. But big wars are strange things that can take totally unpredicted turns.

results.adx_keywords: Primaries and Caucuses;United States Politics and Government;Atlanta (Ga);DeKalb County (Ga);Georgia
results.title: A candidate in Georgia who appeared to get few Election Day votes was actually in first place.
results.abstract: The discrepancy in a race for a county-level board of commissioners seat was blamed on a series of technical errors.

media.caption: “I hope that this never happens to another candidate,” said Michelle Long Spears, who was seeking a board of commissioners seat.

results.adx_keywords: Clinical Trials;Breast Cancer;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals);Chemotherapy;Research;AstraZeneca PLC;American Society of Clinical Oncology;New England Journal of Medicine;Memorial Sloan-Kettering Cancer Center;Cleveland Clinic;Daiichi Sankyo Co
results.title: Breast Cancer Drug Trial Results in ‘Unheard-Of’ Survival Rates
results.abstract: For some patients with metastatic tumors not significantly affected by other forms of chemotherapy, the treatment halted their cancer’s growth.

media.caption: A colored scanning electron micrograph of breast cancer cells. Patients treated with the new drug trastuzumab deruxtecan survived for 23.9 months.

results.adx_keywords: Storming of the US Capitol (Jan, 2021);Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right;Treason and Sedition;United States Politics and Government;Tarrio, Enrique;Pezzola, Dominic;Rehl, Zach;Nordean, Ethan;Biggs, Joseph (1984- );Proud Boys;Justice Department;Oath Keepers
results.byline: By Alan Feuer, Adam Goldman and Luke Broadwater
results.title: Proud Boys Charged With Sedition in Capitol Attack
results.abstract: An amended federal indictment charged five members of the far-right group, including Enrique Tarrio, its former leader, with seditious conspiracy for their roles in the Jan. 6 assault.

media.caption: Enrique Tarrio, the former leader of the Proud Boys, was not in Washington on Jan. 6, 2021. But prosecutors have said he “led the advance planning and remained in contact with other members of the Proud Boys” during the Capitol riot.
media.copyright: Eva Marie Uzcategui/Agence France-Presse — Getty Images

results.title: After Doping Scandal, Figure Skating Will Raise Age Limit to 17
results.abstract: The minimum age for elite skaters will be phased in over three years and be in place in time for the 2026 Olympics.

media.caption: A doping scandal involving the 15-year-old Russian Kamila Valieva sparked a debate about age limits in elite skating.

results.title: It’s Been 50 Years. I Am Not ‘Napalm Girl’ Anymore.
results.abstract: The surviving people in war photographs, especially the children, must somehow go on. We are not symbols. We are human.

results.title: As the Great Salt Lake Dries Up, Utah Faces An ‘Environmental Nuclear Bomb’
results.abstract: Climate change and rapid population growth are shrinking the lake, creating a bowl of toxic dust that could poison the air around Salt Lake City.

media.copyright: Bryan Tarnowski for The New York Times

results.title: How Updates in iOS 16 and Android 13 Will Change Your Phone
results.abstract: Soon, iPhone owners will be able to edit text messages, and Android owners will be able to send high-resolution photos. Many of the changes are long overdue.

results.title: Voters in San Francisco topple the city’s progressive district attorney, Chesa Boudin.
results.abstract: Mr. Boudin, who had eliminated cash bail and sought to reduce the prison population, was removed in a vote that is set to reverberate through Democratic politics across the country.

media.caption: District Attorney Chesa Boudin with family members in San Francisco after being recalled Tuesday night.

results.title: A Young Horn Player Could Become ‘a Real Legend’
results.abstract: At 21, Nathaniel Silberschlag landed a principal seat with the storied Cleveland Orchestra. Now tenured, he doesn’t ever want to leave.

media.caption: Nathaniel Silberschlag, a musician from a family of musicians, at Severance Hall, the Cleveland Orchestra’s home.
